analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'i sems pa lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the virtuous intention that focuses on neutral states.

original: dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the virtuous intention that focuses on virtuous and non-virtuous states?

original: smras pa / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang /
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang /
translated: It is said: “The virtuous and non-virtuous physical, verbal, and mental actions, the virtuous and non-virtuous mental factors, the virtuous and non-virtuous non-associated compositional factors,

original: chos 'di dag ni rgyu las byung ba /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni rgyu las byung ba /
translated: and these phenomena are produced from a cause,

original: 'bras bu yod pa rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
translated: The intention is the mental factor that thinks, “The result exists and has a ripened effect.”

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
translated: This is connected with the mental factor of intention up to the mental action of the mind.

original: 'di ni dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is virtuous intention that focuses on the virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is virtuous intention that focuses on the virtuous and neutral?

original: smras pa / dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang /
translated: It is said: The virtuous actions of body and speech, the virtuous mind and mental factors, the formations not associated with a virtuous mind, the neutral form, the neutral mind and mental factors, and the neutral formations not associated with the mind.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu las byung ba dang / 'bras bu yod pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu las byung ba dang / 'bras bu yod pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
translated: The mental factors, the non-revealing form associated with the neutral mind, and the non-associated compositional factors, are all causally arisen, have results, and have karmic maturation.

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
translated: This is the intention that thinks in this way, and it is the mental activity that is the mental factor, and it is the mental action.

original: 'di ni dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the virtuous intention that focuses on the virtuous and neutral.

original: dge ba'i sems pa mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems pa mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the virtuous intention that focuses on the non-virtuous and neutral?

original: smras pa / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / mi dge ba'i @178b sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang /
analyzed: smras pa / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / mi dge ba'i @178b sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang /
translated: nonvirtuous minds and mental factors, nonvirtuous minds not concomitant with nonvirtuous minds, and nonvirtuous compositional factors, and neutral form,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu las byung ba 'bras bu yod pa /🔽rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu las byung ba 'bras bu yod pa / rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
translated: neutral minds and mental factors, neutral minds not concomitant with neutral minds, and neutral compositional factors—these phenomena are results that arise from causes.🔽They have karmic maturation.”

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
translated: The intention that thinks in this way is applied to the mental factors that form the mind and the mental action of the mind.

original: 'di ni dge ba'i sems pa mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'i sems pa mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the virtuous intention that focuses on nonvirtuous and neutral states.

original: dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the wholesome volition that focuses on the wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral?

original: smras pa / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang /
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang /
translated: It is the wholesome and unwholesome bodily and vocal actions, the wholesome and unwholesome mental states and mental factors, the wholesome and unwholesome formations not associated with the mind,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu las byung ba /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu las byung ba /
translated: the neutral forms, the neutral mental states and mental factors, the neutral formations not associated with the mind, and the phenomena that are the results of uniform outflow.🔽These phenomena arise from causes, have results, and possess karmic ripening.

original: 'bras bu yod pa rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
translated: The volition that attends to them in this way,

original: sems mngon bar 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: sems mngon bar 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
translated: up to the mental formations and mental activity,🔽is called the wholesome volition that focuses on the wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral.

original: 'di ni dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the wholesome intention that focuses on wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral objects.

original: mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the unwholesome intention that focuses on wholesome objects?

original: smras pa / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba 'bras bu med pa /🔽rnam par smin pa med pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
analyzed: smras pa / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba 'bras bu med pa / rnam par smin pa med pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
translated: It is the intention of one who thinks, “Unwholesome bodily action, unwholesome verbal action, unwholesome thoughts, the mental factors that are unwholesome, the formations that are not associated with the mind and are unwholesome, and these phenomena are without cause, without effect,🔽without ripening.”🔽It is the intention of one who thinks in this way, and it is the mental activity that is associated with the formations of the mind, and it is the action of the mind, up to the point of mental activity.

original: sems mngon bar 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar ba dang / yang na chos de dag gi phan yon dang ldan ba'i yid la byed pas yid la byed cing /
analyzed: sems mngon bar 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar ba dang / yang na chos de dag gi phan yon dang ldan ba'i yid la byed pas yid la byed cing /
translated: Moreover, it is the mental activity of one who attends to the benefits of these phenomena,

original: chos 'di dag ni dge ba yin te /🔽skyes @179a * //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni dge ba yin te /🔽skyes @179a * //
translated: thinking, “These phenomena are wholesome,🔽and they are the cause of wholesome phenomena.

original: bu dam pas rang gi rtogs pa sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis bsngags pa nas /
analyzed: bu dam pas rang gi rtogs pa sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis bsngags pa nas /
translated: The holy being should apply this to his own realization, to the praise of the Buddhas and the disciples of the Buddhas,

original: rgyas par gnyi ga la yang gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyas par gnyi ga la yang gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du sbyar te /
translated: and to the praise of the two, up to the point where it does not harm either.

original: shes rab skye bar 'gyur ba dang / phongs par 'gyur ba'i phyogs dang / mthun pa ma yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
analyzed: shes rab skye bar 'gyur ba dang / phongs par 'gyur ba'i phyogs dang / mthun pa ma yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
translated: He should think, “This is the arising of wisdom, this is the side of poverty, this is not in accord, this is nirvana.”

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
translated: He should apply this up to the mental activity and the action of the mind.

original: 'di ni mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the wholesome intention of the unwholesome that takes the wholesome as its object.

original: mi dge ba'i sems pa mi dge ba la dmigs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems pa mi dge ba la dmigs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the unwholesome intention that takes the unwholesome as its object?

original: smras pa / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba 'bras bu med pa /
analyzed: smras pa / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba 'bras bu med pa /
translated: He said: “Nonvirtuous physical and verbal actions, nonvirtuous minds and mental factors, nonvirtuous formations not associated with a nonvirtuous mind and these phenomena arise without a cause, are without result and without karmic maturation.”

original: rnam par smin pa med pa yin no snyam du yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med pa yin no snyam du yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
translated: From this thought,

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar ba dang / yang na chos de dag gi nyes dmigs dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas yid la byed cing chos 'di dag ni mi dge ba yin te /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar ba dang / yang na chos de dag gi nyes dmigs dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas yid la byed cing chos 'di dag ni mi dge ba yin te /
translated: he applied his mind to mental formations and mental actions, or he contemplated these phenomena with the attention that possesses their disadvantages and thought, “These phenomena are nonvirtuous.

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pas /
translated: They are despised by holy beings,

original: rang gi rtogs pa sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams dang dam pa rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams dang dam pa rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ste /
translated: by the buddhas and the buddhas’ śrāvakas, by the sublime ones and by holy beings.

original: zin cing yang dag par zin na /
analyzed: zin cing yang dag par zin na /
translated: If it is seized and held on to,

original: bdag la yang gnod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag la yang gnod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: it will harm oneself,

original: gzhan la yang gnod par 'gyur la gnyi ga la yang gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan la yang gnod par 'gyur la gnyi ga la yang gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: it will harm others, and it will harm both.🔽It will obstruct wisdom, it will be conducive to misfortune, and it will not lead to nirvāṇa.”

original: shes rab 'gag par 'gyur ba dang / phongs par 'gyur ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
analyzed: shes rab 'gag par 'gyur ba dang / phongs par 'gyur ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
translated: This is how you should understand the intention,

original: sems mngon bar 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: sems mngon bar 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
translated: up to the mental activity that produces the mind and the action of the mind.

original: 'di ni mi dge ba'i sems pa mi dge ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dge ba'i sems pa mi dge ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is called unwholesome intention that focuses on the unwholesome.

original: mi dge ba'i sems pa lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems pa lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is unwholesome intention that focuses on the indeterminate?

analyzed: smras pa / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / lung du ma @179b bstan pa'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang chos 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba /
translated: It is said: “One should think, ‘Undeclared form, undeclared mind and mental factors, undeclared non-associated compositional factors, these phenomena are not arisen from causes, they are not results, they do not have karmic ripening.’

original: 'bras bu med pa rnam par smin pa med pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas sems mngon bar 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa rnam par smin pa med pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas sems mngon bar 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
translated: One should think in this way, and one should apply this to the intention, the mental factor, the mental formation, and the action of the mind.

original: 'di ni mi dge ba'i sems pa lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dge ba'i sems pa lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the focus on neutral nonvirtuous intention.

original: mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the focus on virtuous and nonvirtuous intention that is nonvirtuous?

original: smras pa / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams /
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams /
translated: It is said: “Virtuous and nonvirtuous physical and verbal actions, virtuous and nonvirtuous mind and mental factors,

original: dang dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba /
analyzed: dang dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba /
translated: the wholesome and unwholesome minds, the formations not associated with a mind, and these phenomena are without a cause,

analyzed: 'bras bu med pa / rnam par smin pa med pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
translated: without a result,🔽without a ripening.

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /
translated: This is the intention that thinks in this way, and it is connected with the mental activity of directing the mind, and with the action of the mind.

original: 'di ni mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is unwholesome intention that focuses on the wholesome and the unwholesome.

original: mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is unwholesome intention that focuses on the wholesome and the indeterminate?

original: smras pa / dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang /
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / dge ba'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang /
translated: He said: “The virtuous physical and verbal actions, the virtuous minds and mental factors, the virtuous compositional factors not associated with minds, the neutral forms, the neutral minds and mental factors,🔽and the neutral compositional factors not associated with minds—

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / chos 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba /
translated: these phenomena are causeless,

original: 'bras bu med pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa /
translated: have no effect,🔽and have no karmic maturation.”

original: rnam par smin pa med pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med pa yin no snyam du de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa nas /
translated: He thinks in this way and so on, up to:

analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yid kyi las kyi bar du sbyar te /

analyzed: 'di ni mi dge ba'i sems pa dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is nonvirtuous intention that focuses on virtue and the neutral.

original: mi dge ba'i sems pa mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems pa mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /

translated: The actions are summarized by six causes:🔽1. action to be abandoned by insight into suffering,🔽2. action to be abandoned by insight into the origin,🔽3. action to be abandoned by insight into cessation,

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: 4. action to be abandoned by insight into the path,🔽5. action to be abandoned by cultivation,🔽6. action which is not to be abandoned.

original: rgyu bdun gyis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu bdun gyis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Karma is summarized by seven causes.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / gzugs dang ldan pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spong bar bya ba dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / gzugs dang ldan pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spong bar bya ba dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang /
translated: Karma associated with the desire realm is abandoned by the path of seeing and abandoned by the path of meditation. Karma associated with the form realm is abandoned by the path of seeing and abandoned by the path of meditation. Karma associated with the formless realm is abandoned by the path of seeing and abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Karma is not abandoned.

original: rgyu @185b brgyad kyis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu @185b brgyad kyis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Karma is summarized by eight causes.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i las so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i las so //
translated: Karma associated with the desire realm is virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral. Karma associated with the form realm is virtuous and neutral. Karma associated with the formless realm is virtuous and neutral. Karma is not associated with any realm.

original: rgyu dgus las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu dgus las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Karma is summarized by nine causes.

original: lus kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / ngag gi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / yid kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang /🔽lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / ngag gi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / yid kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: and virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral actions of mind.

original: rgyu bcus las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu bcus las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Actions are summarized by ten causes.

original: lus kyi las dge ba zag pa zad pa dang / bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i las so //
analyzed: lus kyi las dge ba zag pa zad pa dang / bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i las so //
translated: Virtuous actions of body that are related to the exhaustion of defilements, non-virtuous actions of body, neutral actions of body, and actions of body that are free from defilements.

original: ngag gi las dge ba zag pa zad pa dang bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i las so //
analyzed: ngag gi las dge ba zag pa zad pa dang bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i las so //
translated: Virtuous actions of speech that are related to the exhaustion of defilements, non-virtuous actions of speech, neutral actions of speech, and actions of speech that are free from defilements.

original: yid kyi las dge ba zag pa zad pa dang bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i las so //
analyzed: yid kyi las dge ba zag pa zad pa dang bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i las so //
translated: Virtuous actions of mind that are related to the exhaustion of defilements, non-virtuous actions of mind, neutral actions of mind, and actions of mind that are free from defilements.

original: rgyu bcu gcig gis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu bcu gcig gis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Actions are summarized by eleven causes.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang /
translated: Virtue and nonvirtue associated with the desire realm, obscured and unobscured neutral states associated with the desire realm, virtue and obscured neutral states associated with form,

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i las so //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i las so //
translated: unobscured neutral states associated with form, virtue and obscured neutral states associated with the formless realm, unobscured neutral states associated with the formless realm and unassociated with any realm.

original: rgyu bcu gnyis kyis las rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu bcu gnyis kyis las rnams bsdus te /
translated: Karma is summarized by twelve causes.

original: lus kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / dag gi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang /
analyzed: lus kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / dag gi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang /
translated: Virtue and nonvirtue, obscured and unobscured neutral states associated with the body, virtue and nonvirtue, obscured and unobscured neutral states associated with speech, virtue and nonvirtue, obscured and unobscured neutral states associated with the mind.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / yid kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //🔽bstan bcos chen po chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / yid kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o // bstan bcos chen po chos mngon pa las /
translated: unobscured-indeterminate mental actions.

original: las gdags pa tshigs dang po'o /
analyzed: las gdags pa tshigs dang po'o /
translated: The first chapter on the presentation of action is concluded.

original: // / sdom ni /
analyzed: // / sdom ni /
translated: The summary:

original: rtsa ba gsum dang dbye @186a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba gsum dang dbye @186a * //
translated: The three roots, the classifications,🔽the ten paths of nonvirtuous action,

original: ba dang // mi dge las lam bcu po dang // yung na las rnams bcu yi rgyu //
analyzed: ba dang // mi dge las lam bcu po dang // yung na las rnams bcu yi rgyu //
translated: the ten virtuous actions,

original: mi dge ba ni gsum po yin //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni gsum po yin //
translated: and the three roots of nonvirtue.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three roots of nonvirtue?

original: gsum ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o//
analyzed: gsum ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o//
translated: The three are the root of nonvirtue attachment, the root of nonvirtue aversion, and the root of nonvirtue delusion.

original: chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the root of nonvirtue attachment?

original: smras pa / 'dod chags pa dang / kun du 'dod chags pa dang / kun du zhen pa dang / chums pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / sred pa dang / tshol ba dang / 'dod pa dang / brgyal ba dang / zhen pa dang /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod chags pa dang / kun du 'dod chags pa dang / kun du zhen pa dang / chums pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / sred pa dang / tshol ba dang / 'dod pa dang / brgyal ba dang / zhen pa dang /
translated: He replied, “It is desire, attachment, complete attachment, satisfaction, excessive attachment, craving, seeking, longing, fainting, clinging,

original: yongs su zhen pa dang / nang gi 'ching ba dang / don du sgrub pa dang / brnab sems dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la chags pa dang / chags pa las byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su zhen pa dang / nang gi 'ching ba dang / don du sgrub pa dang / brnab sems dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la chags pa dang / chags pa las byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and complete clinging. It is the inner fetters, the pursuit of objects, covetousness, suffering, attachment to origination, and what arises from attachment. This is called attachment.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the root of nonvirtue?

original: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin la /
translated: He replied, “It is a phenomenon that is nonvirtuous.

original: de ni mi dge ba'i chos mang po'i rtsa ba gang yin pas na /
analyzed: de ni mi dge ba'i chos mang po'i rtsa ba gang yin pas na /
translated: It is the root of many nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: de'i phyir de ni nad kyi rtsa ba dang / 'bras kyi rtsa ba dang / zug rngu'i rtsa ba dang / sdig pa'i rtsa ba dang / rnam par ma dag ba'i rtsa ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni nad kyi rtsa ba dang / 'bras kyi rtsa ba dang / zug rngu'i rtsa ba dang / sdig pa'i rtsa ba dang / rnam par ma dag ba'i rtsa ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: Therefore, it is the root of disease, the root of tumors, the root of pain, the root of evil, the root of impurity, the root of affliction, the root of non-purification,

original: yongs su byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba yin te /
translated: and the root of non-purification.

original: de bas na chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the root of non-virtue.

original: zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba la zhe sdang gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba la zhe sdang gang zhe na /
translated: As for the statement hatred is the root of non-virtue, what is hatred?

original: smras pa / sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems dang / tha ba dang / khong khro ba dang / gnod sems dang / gnod sems su byed pa dang / gnod sems su gyur ba dang / sdang ba dang / rab tu sdang ba dang /
analyzed: smras pa / sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems dang / tha ba dang / khong khro ba dang / gnod sems dang / gnod sems su byed pa dang / gnod sems su gyur ba dang / sdang ba dang / rab tu sdang ba dang /
translated: It is said: Hatred is the malice, harshness, anger, ill-will, the state of being ill-willed, hostility, extreme hostility,

original: sems kyis sdang ba gang yin ba dang / sems can rnams la mi mthun par byed pa dang / sdang ba dang / sdang bar byed pa dang sdang bar gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni zhe sdang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyis sdang ba gang yin ba dang / sems can rnams la mi mthun par byed pa dang / sdang ba dang / sdang bar byed pa dang sdang bar gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni zhe sdang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that is hostile, the mind that is not in harmony with sentient beings, the mind that is hostile, the mind that causes hostility, the mind that is hostile, is called hostility.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is called unwholesome root?

original: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin pa nas rgyas par yongs su byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin pa nas rgyas par yongs su byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar te /
translated: It is said: That which is unwholesome, and so on up to: the root of what is not purified.

original: de bas na zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, hostility is called an unwholesome root.

original: gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is called unwholesome root of delusion?

original: gti mug gang zhe na /
analyzed: gti mug gang zhe na /
translated: What is delusion?

original: smras pa / sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes @186b pa dang / dbus kyi mtha' mi shes pa dang / nang mi shes pa dang / phyi rol mi shes pa dang / nang dang phyi rol mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: smras pa / sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes @186b pa dang / dbus kyi mtha' mi shes pa dang / nang mi shes pa dang / phyi rol mi shes pa dang / nang dang phyi rol mi shes pa dang /
translated: It is said: Not knowing the past, not knowing the future, not knowing the present, not knowing the internal, not knowing the external, not knowing the internal and external,

original: las mi shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang / las legs par byas pa mi shes pa dang / las nyes par byas pa mi shes pa dang / las legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa mi shes pa dang /🔽rgyu mi shes pa dang / rgyu las skyes pa'i chos rnams mi shes pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / gnag pa dang / dkar ba dang /
analyzed: las mi shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang / las legs par byas pa mi shes pa dang / las nyes par byas pa mi shes pa dang / las legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa mi shes pa dang / rgyu mi shes pa dang / rgyu las skyes pa'i chos rnams mi shes pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / gnag pa dang / dkar ba dang /
translated: They do not understand karma, they do not understand ripening, they do not understand karma and ripening, they do not understand good karma, they do not understand bad karma, they do not understand good and bad karma,🔽they do not understand causes, they do not understand phenomena that arise from causes, they do not understand what is reprehensible and what is not, what is bad and what is good, what is dark and what is bright,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa mi shes pa dang / reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes mi mthong ba dang / mun pa dang / rmongs pa dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa mi shes pa dang / reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes mi mthong ba dang / mun pa dang / rmongs pa dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang /
translated: they do not understand dependent origination together with its divisions, they do not understand and see the six sense bases of contact as they are, they are in darkness, confused, in the darkness of ignorance,

original: glog dang / rnyog pa can dang / bsgribs pa dang / chod pa dang / long par byed pa dang / mig med par byed pa dang / shes rab dang mi mthun pa dang / phongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: glog dang / rnyog pa can dang / bsgribs pa dang / chod pa dang / long par byed pa dang / mig med par byed pa dang / shes rab dang mi mthun pa dang / phongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: It is like a thorn, a dart, a wound, a fetter, a snare, a net, a trap, a cage, a shadow, a stain, a veil, an obstruction, a hindrance, a blindness, a blindness-maker, a foe of wisdom, a friend of misfortune, a hindrance to nirvana,

original: ma rig pa dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi rtsa ba dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi sdong po dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi lo ma dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi me tog dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi rtsa ba dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi sdong po dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi lo ma dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi me tog dang / ma rig pa'i dug gi 'bras bu dang /
translated: ignorance, the flood of ignorance, the root of ignorance, the trunk of ignorance, the leaves of ignorance, the flowers of ignorance, the fruits of ignorance,

original: rmongs pa dang / kun du rmongs pa dang / rab tu rmongs pa dang / gti mug dang / gti mug las byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni gti mug ces bya'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa dang / kun du rmongs pa dang / rab tu rmongs pa dang / gti mug dang / gti mug las byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni gti mug ces bya'o //
translated: delusion, complete delusion, great delusion, confusion, and what arises from confusion.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the root of nonvirtue?

original: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / chos de mi dge ba yin la /
translated: It is that which is nonvirtuous.

original: de ni mi dge ba'i chos mang po'i rtsa ba yang yin pas na /
analyzed: de ni mi dge ba'i chos mang po'i rtsa ba yang yin pas na /
translated: It is also the root of many nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: de'i phyir de ni nad kyi rtsa ba nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni nad kyi rtsa ba nas /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is the root of disease,

original: yongs su byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba yin pa'i bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba ma yin pa'i rtsa ba yin pa'i bar du sbyar te /
translated: up to the root of not being completely purified.

original: da bas na gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da bas na gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the root of nonvirtue.🔽The ten paths of nonvirtuous action are killing, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct,

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / ka ca ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / ka ca ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: and the three kinds of verbal action—lying, divisive speech, and offensive speech.🔽There are three kinds of covetousness:🔽arisen from attachment,🔽arisen from hatred, and

original: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: arisen from delusion.

original: ma byin par len pa chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is taking what is not given that arises from attachment?

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de /🔽des gzhan dag las ma @187a * //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de / des gzhan dag las ma @187a * //
translated: It is like this: someone here, desiring some property,

original: byin par len par byed do //
analyzed: byin par len par byed do //
translated: takes it from others without their permission.

original: de ma yin te bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de ma yin te bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Even if one does not desire it for oneself, one thinks like this:🔽“If I do not take it, someone else will.”

original: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du gzhan dag las ma byin par len par byed do //
analyzed: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du gzhan dag las ma byin par len par byed do //
translated: They think, Those sentient beings who are dear to me, who are cherished, who are loved, and who are pleasing to me will have what they need, will have what they want, and will have what is delightful to them. For their sake, they take what is not given from others.

original: yang na gzhan dag de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la /🔽ming 'di zhes bya ba las ma byin par long shig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la / ming 'di zhes bya ba las ma byin par long shig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
translated: Or others tell them, Come here.

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o zhes bsgo nas /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o zhes bsgo nas /
translated: Take what is not given from so-and-so, and I will give you such-and-such, and I will do such-and-such for you.

original: des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas /
analyzed: des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas /
translated: Having been told this, they think, I want those enjoyments.

original: gzhan dag las ma byin par len par byed pa de lta bu ni chags pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag las ma byin par len par byed pa de lta bu ni chags pa las byung ba yin no //

translated: Slander is of three kinds:

original: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: born of attachment, born of aversion, and born of delusion.

original: phra ma chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: phra ma chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is slander born of attachment?

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang / de'i rkyen gyis de gzhan dag gi mdza' bo 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang / de'i rkyen gyis de gzhan dag gi mdza' bo 'byed par byed do //
translated: It is when someone, for the sake of gain, splits apart friends who are in harmony.

original: de ma yin te bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ma yin te bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang /
translated: Or, even if he does not want to do so himself,

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: he thinks:🔽‘If I do this, I will get such and such a gain.’

original: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du /
analyzed: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas de dag gi don du /
translated: Those sentient beings who are dear to me, who are cherished, who are loved, and who are pleasing, will have the necessities, will have possessions, and will have enjoyments.

original: gzhan dag gi mdza' bo 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi mdza' bo 'byed par byed do //
translated: For their sake, he causes division among others' friends.

original: yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la ming 'di zhes bya ba'i mdza' bo phye shig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la ming 'di zhes bya ba'i mdza' bo phye shig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
translated: Or, others may say to him, Come here! Divide the friends of so-and-so, and I will give you this and that.

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o zhes bsgo nas /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o zhes bsgo nas /
translated: Having said, I will do this and that for you,

original: des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas gzhan dag gi mdza' bo 'byed bar byed do //
analyzed: des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas gzhan dag gi mdza' bo 'byed bar byed do //
translated: he causes division among others' friends because he desires those enjoyments.

original: dper na bram ze'i bsod snyoms snyer ba'i khyim nor ma gos pa de dag las /
analyzed: dper na bram ze'i bsod snyoms snyer ba'i khyim nor ma gos pa de dag las /
translated: For example, in a house where the brahmin's alms are collected, there is no loss of wealth.

original: de'i lhung bzed gcig dang / gos gcig dang / zan gcig pu 'ong ba la de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de'i lhung bzed gcig dang / gos gcig dang / zan gcig pu 'ong ba la de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: From that, only one begging bowl, one piece of clothing, and one meal come to him. He thinks,

original: ji srid du 'di dag lhan cig na 'khod cing mthun pa de srid du 'di dag las bdag gis lhung bzed gcig dang gos gcig dang / zan gcig pu 'ong gis /
analyzed: ji srid du 'di dag lhan cig na 'khod cing mthun pa de srid du 'di dag las bdag gis lhung bzed gcig dang gos gcig dang / zan gcig pu 'ong gis /
translated: As long as they live together in harmony, I will not get their single begging-bowl, their single garment, or their single morsel of food.

original: bdag gis 'di dag dbye ba'i thabs shig bya gor ma chag snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di dag dbye ba'i thabs shig bya gor ma chag snyam nas /
translated: I must find a way to divide them.

original: de dag 'byed pa'i thabs byed pa lta bu dang / dper na rgyal po gnyis phan tshun mi mthun te nang na 'khod pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi longs spyod 'dod nas /
analyzed: de dag 'byed pa'i thabs byed pa lta bu dang / dper na rgyal po gnyis phan tshun mi mthun te nang na 'khod pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi longs spyod 'dod nas /
translated: For example, it is like two kings who are mutually hostile. Those who live within the kingdom want the wealth of those outside.

original: phyi rol pa rnams dbye ba'i thabs byed la /
analyzed: phyi rol pa rnams dbye ba'i thabs byed la /
translated: They try to find a way to divide the outsiders.

original: phyi rol pa rnams ni nang gi longs spyod 'dod nas nang na 'khod pa rnams dbye ba'i thabs byed pa de lta bu ni chags pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol pa rnams ni nang gi longs spyod 'dod nas nang na 'khod pa rnams dbye ba'i thabs byed pa de lta bu ni chags pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: The outsiders want the wealth of those within and try to find a way to divide those within. This is the origin of schism through attachment.

original: zhe sdang las @194b byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang las @194b byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the origin of schism through hatred?

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig gang la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems yod pa de'i mdza' bo 'byed do //🔽de ma yin te de la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems med du zin kyang sems can de gang dag sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la kun nas mnar sems dang /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig gang la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems yod pa de'i mdza' bo 'byed do // de ma yin te de la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems med du zin kyang sems can de gang dag sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la kun nas mnar sems dang /
translated: He said, “Here, some people create divisions among friends,🔽but not because they have a hostile or angry mind toward those friends.🔽Rather, it is because they have a hostile or angry mind toward those sentient beings who are dear to and loved by those friends,

original: khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir /
translated: and who are attractive, cherished, delightful, and pleasing to them.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “They think,

original: de dag yun ring por mi bzod cing /
analyzed: de dag yun ring por mi bzod cing /
translated: ‘I will make them feel long-lasting displeasure,

original: mi bde la sems mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: mi bde la sems mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: unhappiness, and mental unease.’

original: de dag gi mdza' bo de 'byed par byed pa de lta bu ni zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi mdza' bo de 'byed par byed pa de lta bu ni zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
translated: “Thus, they create divisions among friends. This is the type of divisive speech that arises from hostility.

original: gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the type of divisive speech that arises from delusion?

original: bram ze dag 'di skad du lug gsod pa dang / bya gag gsod pa dang / phag gsod pa dang / bya ba dang / rngon pa dang / chom rkun dang / gshed ma dang / brtson rdzi dang / khyi sha can dang / ri bong rgyas 'tshor ba gang yin pa 'di dag ni dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze dag 'di skad du lug gsod pa dang / bya gag gsod pa dang / phag gsod pa dang / bya ba dang / rngon pa dang / chom rkun dang / gshed ma dang / brtson rdzi dang / khyi sha can dang / ri bong rgyas 'tshor ba gang yin pa 'di dag ni dbye bar bya'o //
translated: The Brahmins say: “Those who kill sheep, those who kill chickens, those who kill pigs, those who hunt birds, those who hunt deer, those who are thieves, those who are executioners, those who are butchers, those who are fishermen, those who are trappers, should be excluded.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: ji srid du 'di dag lhan cig 'khod cing mthun pa de srid du bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji srid du 'di dag lhan cig 'khod cing mthun pa de srid du bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: As long as they live together and agree, non-meritorious action increases greatly.

original: phye na ni de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: phye na ni de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
translated: If they are divided, it will not be that way.

original: las de la ci yang mi 'ong bar lta zhing /
analyzed: las de la ci yang mi 'ong bar lta zhing /
translated: ” They see that action as nothing at all.

original: 'bras bu med par lta la /
analyzed: 'bras bu med par lta la /
translated: They see it as fruitless.

original: 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: They see it like this and say like this:

original: las 'di med do //
analyzed: las 'di med do //
translated: “This action does not exist.

original: las 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes te /
analyzed: las 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes te /
translated: This action does not have a result that matures.”

original: gti mug las byung ba'i phra ma zer ba de lta bu ni gti mug las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba'i phra ma zer ba de lta bu ni gti mug las byung ba yin no //
translated: Such slander that arises from delusion arises from delusion.

original: tshig rtsub po ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Harsh speech is of three types:

original: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: arisen from attachment, arisen from aversion, and arisen from ignorance.

original: tshig rtsub po chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is harsh speech arisen from attachment?

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang / rkyen gyis gzhan la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang / rkyen gyis gzhan la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod par byed do //
translated: It is the use of harsh words by someone who is attached to wealth, sex, or power.

original: de ma yin te bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de ma yin te bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Or it is the use of harsh words by someone who is not attached to these things, but who thinks:

original: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: “These sentient beings are dear to me, precious to me, loved by me, and pleasing to me.

original: de dag gi don du gzhan la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod par byed do //🔽dper na yi ge 'am /
analyzed: de dag gi don du gzhan la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod par byed do // dper na yi ge 'am /
translated: I will use harsh words toward others for their sake.”

original: rtsis sam / bgrang ba @195a * //
analyzed: rtsis sam / bgrang ba @195a * //
translated: For example, it is like the use of harsh words by a teacher🔽who is teaching the alphabet,

original: 'am / lag rtsis sam /🔽bzo'i gnas sam /
analyzed: 'am / lag rtsis sam /🔽bzo'i gnas sam /
translated: or by a mathematician,🔽or by someone who is teaching a craft.

original: las kyi gnas gang yang rung ba'i sgo nas grong dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang de dang de dag tu bskos na /🔽des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas /
analyzed: las kyi gnas gang yang rung ba'i sgo nas grong dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang de dang de dag tu bskos na / des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas /
translated: If he is appointed to a position in a village, town, country, or royal palace,

original: gzhan la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod par byed do //
translated: he will use that wealth to speak harshly to others.

original: yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la ming 'di zhes bya ba la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod cig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la ming 'di zhes bya ba la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod cig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
translated: Or, if someone tells him, “Come here! Speak harshly to so-and-so, and I will give you this and that,

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o zhes bsgo nas /🔽des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o zhes bsgo nas / des longs spyod de dag 'dod nas /
translated: and I will do this and that for you,”🔽he will use that wealth to speak harshly to others.

original: gzhan la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod par byed pa de lta bu ni chags pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod par byed pa de lta bu ni chags pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the type of harsh speech that arises from attraction.

original: zhe sdang las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the type of harsh speech that arises from aversion?

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig gang la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir /🔽de la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod par byed do //🔽de ma yin te de la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems med du zin kyang gang dag gi sems can sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la kun nas mnar sems dang /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig gang la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir / de la tshig rtsub po kun du spyod par byed do // de ma yin te de la kun nas mnar sems dang / khro ba'i sems med du zin kyang gang dag gi sems can sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la kun nas mnar sems dang /
translated: He said, “Here, some people use harsh speech toward others because they have a mind of malice and anger toward them.

original: khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: khro ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: But others use harsh speech toward others not because they have a mind of malice and anger toward them, but because they have a mind of malice and anger toward those who are dear, cherished, loved, and pleasing to them.

original: de dag yun ring por mi bzod cing /
analyzed: de dag yun ring por mi bzod cing /
translated: They think, “I will make those beings unhappy for a long time.

original: mi bde la sems mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: mi bde la sems mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: I will make them unhappy and cause them to have an unpleasant and disagreeable mind.”

original: sems can de dag la tshig rdzub po kun du spyod par byed pa de lta bu ni zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can de dag la tshig rdzub po kun du spyod par byed pa de lta bu ni zhe sdang las byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, they use harsh speech toward those beings. This is the kind that arises from hatred.

original: gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the kind that arises from delusion?

original: smras pa / dper na mi'i las spyod pa dang / ral pa can dag ni phal cher tshig rtsub po smra ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / dper na mi'i las spyod pa dang / ral pa can dag ni phal cher tshig rtsub po smra ba yin te /
translated: For example, the actions of humans and the matted-hair ascetics are mostly harsh speech.

original: de dag gi slob ma khyim pa gos dkar po can gang yin pa de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de dag gi slob ma khyim pa gos dkar po can gang yin pa de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Their students, the householders who wear white clothes, think this:

original: bdag cag gi ston pa ni shes pas shes shing /
analyzed: bdag cag gi ston pa ni shes pas shes shing /
translated: “Our teacher is wise and knows through wisdom.

original: mthong bas mthong la de tshig rtsub po smra ba las ni 'di lta ste tshig rtsub po 'di ni legs pa zhig yin gor ma chag go //
analyzed: mthong bas mthong la de tshig rtsub po smra ba las ni 'di lta ste tshig rtsub po 'di ni legs pa zhig yin gor ma chag go //
translated: He sees through seeing. Since he speaks harsh words, it must be that harsh words are good.

original: 'di ni shin tu bzang po zhig yin gor ma chag go snyam ste /
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu bzang po zhig yin gor ma chag go snyam ste /
translated: It must be that this is very good.”

original: las de la ci yang mi 'ong bar lta zhing /
analyzed: las de la ci yang mi 'ong bar lta zhing /
translated: They see that action as having no result at all.

original: 'bras bu med par lta la 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu med par lta la 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: They see it as having no fruit, and they say:

original: las 'di med do //
analyzed: las 'di med do //
translated: “This action does not exist.

original: las 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: las 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes zer te /
translated: The result of this action does not exist.”

original: gti mug @195b las byung ba'i tshig rtsub po smra ba de lta bu ni /
analyzed: gti mug @195b las byung ba'i tshig rtsub po smra ba de lta bu ni /
translated: Such harsh speech that arises from delusion

original: gti mug las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba yin no //
translated: arises from delusion.

original: tshig kyal pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshig kyal pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Frivolous speech is of three types:

original: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba dang / zhe sdang las byung ba dang / gti mug las byung ba'o //
translated: arisen from attachment, arisen from aversion, and arisen from delusion.

original: tshig kyal ba chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig kyal ba chags pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is frivolous speech arisen from attachment?

original: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang / de'i rkyen gyis gzhan dag la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar 'di na kha cig yo byad gang 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang / de'i rkyen gyis gzhan dag la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed do //
translated: It is like this: someone, for the sake of obtaining some object, deceives others with frivolous speech.

original: de ma yin te bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ma yin te bdag nyid mi 'dod du zin kyang /
translated: Even if he does not desire it himself,

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: he thinks:

original: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / de dag gi longs spyod du gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: sems can bdag la sdug pa dang / gces pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba de dag la mkho ba dang / 'chang ba dang / de dag gi longs spyod du gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: “Those sentient beings who are dear to me, who are cherished, who are loved, and who are pleasing to me—may they obtain and possess this, and may it be their enjoyment.”

original: de dag gi don du gzhan la tshig kyal bas 'drid par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi don du gzhan la tshig kyal bas 'drid par byed do //
translated: For their sake, he deceives others with frivolous speech.

original: yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la /
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis de la 'di skad du khyod tshur shog la /
translated: Or else, others say to him: “Come here!

original: ming 'di zhes bya ba la tshig kyal pas drid  cig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bya ba la tshig kyal pas drid  cig dang / ngas khyod la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig sbyin no //
translated: For example, someone might say, I will give you this and that if you deceive so-and-so with idle chatter,

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o zhes bsgo nas /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o zhes bsgo nas /
translated: and I will do this and that for you.

original: de longs spyod de dag 'dod nas /
analyzed: de longs spyod de dag 'dod nas /
translated: Then, desiring those resources,

original: gzhan dag la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag la tshig kyal pas 'drid par byed de /
translated: that person deceives others with idle chatter.🔽For example, a woman who is dependent on a man speaks a lot of idle chatter,🔽and a man who is dependent on a woman speaks a lot of idle chatter.

original: dper na bud med skyes pa la rag las na tshig kyal pa mang du smra ba dang / skyes pa bud med la rag las na tshig kyal pa mang du smra ba lta bu dang / dper na zlos gar mkhan dang / gar mkhan dang /
analyzed: dper na bud med skyes pa la rag las na tshig kyal pa mang du smra ba dang / skyes pa bud med la rag las na tshig kyal pa mang du smra ba lta bu dang / dper na zlos gar mkhan dang / gar mkhan dang /
translated: For example, actors, dancers,

original: bzhad gad pa dang / sgeg pa dang / smad 'tshong ma dang / smad 'tshong ma'i gtso mo dang / sgyu rtsal byed pa rnams kyis gzhan dag gi longs spyod dag 'dod nas /
analyzed: bzhad gad pa dang / sgeg pa dang / smad 'tshong ma dang / smad 'tshong ma'i gtso mo dang / sgyu rtsal byed pa rnams kyis gzhan dag gi longs spyod dag 'dod nas /
translated: comedians, charlatans, prostitutes, brothel madams, and magicians, desiring the resources of others,

original: gzhan dag la tshig kyal pa smra bar byed pa lta bu 'am /
analyzed: gzhan dag la tshig kyal pa smra bar byed pa lta bu 'am /
translated: speak a lot of idle chatter to others.

original: yang na sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dbyangs dang sbyor ba la chags te /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dbyangs dang sbyor ba la chags te /
translated: Or else, one is attached to the melody of the Buddha's words.

original: chags pa las byung ba'i tshig kyal pa smra ba de lta bu ni chags pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba'i tshig kyal pa smra ba de lta bu ni chags pa las byung ba yin no //

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: It does not arise from a cause of the future.

original: smras pa / med do //
analyzed: smras pa / med do //
translated: He replied, “No.”🔽

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems pa ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems pa ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin la /
translated: The future intention arises from a cause of the present and the future.

original: 'das pa'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there any that does not arise from a cause of the past?

original: smras pa / yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de /
translated: Yes.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa mngon sum du gyur pa @210b na de las gzhan pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa mngon sum du gyur pa @210b na de las gzhan pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the future intention that is other than the future intention that is present in the perseverance for the knowledge of the teaching on suffering.

original: de'i ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is its cause of the future?

original: smras pa / lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: smras pa / lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The co-existent and concomitant phenomena.

original: de'i da ltar byung ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i da ltar byung ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is its cause that is present?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: It is the perseverance for the knowledge of the teaching on suffering and the factors associated with it.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu las byung pa yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu las byung pa yin la /
translated: The future intention is a result that arises from a past cause and a future cause.

original: da ltar byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba la ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba la ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there a result that arises from a present cause but not from a past or future cause?

original: smras pa / yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de /
translated: It is said: There is.

original: de'i ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is its future cause?

original: smras pa / lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: smras pa / lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: It is the factors that are co-arisen and associated.

original: de'i 'das pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'das pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is its past cause?

original: smras pa / 'das pa'i chos gang yin pa rnams kyis ni sems pa de dang 'dra ba'am rnam par smin pa yin gyi /🔽da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi ni sems pa de dang 'dra pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / 'das pa'i chos gang yin pa rnams kyis ni sems pa de dang 'dra ba'am rnam par smin pa yin gyi / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi ni sems pa de dang 'dra pa'am /
translated: It is said: The past factors are the similar cause and the cause of karmic maturation of that intention.

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
translated: The present factors are not the similar cause or the cause of karmic maturation of that intention.
